title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Cookies with Store Bought Dough

steps.title: Buy a package of pre-made cookie dough.
steps.content: Buy a package of pre-made cookie dough.

steps.title: Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF(make sure you take out anything that was in the oven).
steps.content: Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF(make sure you take out anything that was in the oven).

steps.title: Cut slices of dough 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) thick.
steps.content: Cut slices of dough 1 ⁄ 2 inch (1.3 cm) thick. Line the cookie tray with aluminum foil, parchment paper, flour, or a type of Pam spray on the tray itself to prevent the dough from sticking.

steps.title: Place the cookie dough balls on the tray, evenly spaced.
steps.content: Place the cookie dough balls on the tray, evenly spaced. Make a full tray. Approximately 16, 20, or 24 cookies.

steps.title: Put the tray in the oven after your oven beeps.
steps.content: Put the tray in the oven after your oven beeps. Set the timer for 12 minutes (Be sure to read cookie dough package, as cooking times may vary).

steps.title: When the timer beeps, indicating that your cookies are done, use an oven mitt to take out the cookie tray.
steps.content: When the timer beeps, indicating that your cookies are done, use an oven mitt to take out the cookie tray.
